messages.msgSnippet: Mine was a dump for clean laundry  Tracy On 15 Jun 2000, at 11:02, The White s wrote: My son is 7 and still sleeps in family bed with us and his sister who
messages.messageBody:
Mine was a dump for clean laundry <g>

Tracy

On 15 Jun 2000, at 11:02, The White's wrote:

My son is 7 and still sleeps in family bed with us and
his sister who is 3.

We kept our crib, which was NEVER used by the children,
until Dillon was 4.
It was "the baby bed" where we kept all the stuffed
animals!!!

Cindy

messages.subject: unused crib
messages.msgSnippet: We tried putting the two twin size beds ... Try using something to bind the matresses together (like the infinately long and very strong celephane wrap that
messages.messageBody:
We tried putting the two twin size beds
>together to make a king size but it was terrible for whoever ended up in the
>crack. Any suggestions would be wonderful as I miss sleeping with my
>babies!
>
>Holly=)

Try using something to bind the matresses together (like the infinately long and very strong celephane wrap that you get at moving supply places, or even just some srong flat ribbon wrapped several times around the matresses. Then put a foam pad over the whole thing, eggcrate, or whatever. You can mail order a king size foam pad, if there is no place available to get one near you. See if that works.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: unused crib
messages.msgSnippet: My own father never quite got it.He asked me once when Gary was about four ... Trisha My mother asked me, when Dillon was probably about 6 months old,
messages.messageBody:
<SNIP> My own father never quite got it.He asked me once >when Gary was
about four
>months old " If he doesn't sleep during the day, what does >he do?" he >
>couldn't >>understand why I wouldn't put him in a crib and >leave him in
>another room! And this is a man who has 3 children of his >own!>>
Trisha>

My mother asked me, when Dillon was probably about 6 months old, when I was
going to put him on a schedule. I told her I would when he learns to read
time. :-)

Also, a co-worker of mine started on me one day about how we parent (AP) vs.
how she parents. She was appalled that I would sleep with my baby, even let
him sleep in a sling or on my lap at naptime. I responded that even dogs
sleep with their babies.
There's just no talking to me sometimes! (BWEG)

Cindy

messages.subject: unused crib
messages.msgSnippet: My son is 7 and still sleeps in family bed with us and his sister who is 3. We kept our crib, which was NEVER used by the children, until Dillon was 4. It was
messages.messageBody:
My son is 7 and still sleeps in family bed with us and his sister who is 3.

We kept our crib, which was NEVER used by the children, until Dillon was 4.
It was "the baby bed" where we kept all the stuffed animals!!!

Cindy
